about_the_game:
The first comic in the universe of the game Saturn. Dmitry Gavrilov, a young and ambitious scientist, discovers Ether Threads—a revolutionary technology that allows human operators to interface with machines on remote planets across the Solar System. This innovation marks a turning point in humanity's exploration of space.

Over five episodes, set between 2033 and 2050, the comic delves into the struggles behind this groundbreaking discovery.

2033: Isolated and dismissed by the academic community, Gavrilov stands firm in his vision. Unexpected allies emerge, reigniting his determination to prove the potential of Ether Threads.

2035: The boundaries of technology and ethics are tested when Gavrilov faces an AI that uses Ether Threads to connect with human consciousness.

2037: Akim Kovalev, Gavrilov’s dedicated graduate student, discovers the missing piece that makes seamless human-to-machine connections possible. This leads to the creation of Reflection, a remote robotic control system that becomes the backbone of space exploration in the world of Saturn.

This story highlights the challenges and triumphs of those who dared to advance human ingenuity, laying the foundation for Reflection technology.

Note. The comic can be found in the game's installation folder.
